parameters.name: location
parameters.description: This string indicates the geographic area to be used when searching for businesses. Examples: "New York City", "NYC", "350 5th Ave, New York, NY 10118". Businesses returned in the response may not be strictly within the specified location.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: Latitude of the location to search from. If latitude is provided, longitude is required too.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: Longitude of the location to search from. If longitude is provided, latitude is required too.

parameters.name: term
parameters.description: Search term, e.g. "food" or "restaurants". The term may also be the business's name, such as "Starbucks". If term is not included the endpoint will default to searching across businesses from a small number of popular categories.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: A suggested search radius in meters. This field is used as a suggestion to the search. The actual search radius may be lower than the suggested radius in dense urban areas, and higher in regions of less business density. If the specified value is too large, a AREA_TOO_LARGE error may be returned. The max value is 40,000 meters (about 25 miles).

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: Categories to filter the search results with. See the list of supported categories. The category filter can be a list of comma delimited categories. e.g., "bars,french" will filter by Bars OR French. The category alias should be used (e.g. "discgolf", not "Disc Golf").

parameters.name: menu
parameters.description: A comma delimited string representing menu items served at this restaurant.

parameters.name: ingredients
parameters.description: A comma delimited string representing ingredients used at this restaurant, this is used to inform users of potential allergens.
